channel.title: Global Alignment on BMMB 554 / 2017
channel.description: Recent content in Global Alignment on BMMB 554 / 2017

item.title: 4. Aligning sequences with dynamic programming
item.description: Sequence alignment In the previous lecture we have seen the principle behind dynamic programming. This approach is extremely useful for comparing biological sequences, which is coincidentally one of the main points of this course. This lecture explain how this is done. In writing this text I heavily relied on wonderful course taught by Ben Langmead at Johns Hopkins. The cover image shows pairwise alignments for human, mouse, and dog KIF3 locus from Dubchak et al.
